==Manage &rarr; Import==

Imporing data into your WordPress blog is many times, necessary and useful.  If you are moving from another host, or just to start your blog anew, then import data into your blog may be the answer.  

Remember that [[Importing Content]] has explicit details about most of the import choices listed below. 

[[Image:manageimport.png|640px|right|Manage Import SubPanel]]


Back to [[Administration Panels]].


If you have posts or comments in another system, WordPress can import those into this blog. To get started, choose a system to import from below:
; [[Importing Content#Blogger|Blogger]] : Import posts, comments, and users from a Blogger blog.
; [[Importing Content#Blogware|Blogware]] : Import posts from Blogware.
; Bunny’s Technorati Tags : Import Bunny’s Technorati Tags into WordPress tags.
; Categories to Tags Converter : Convert existing categories to tags, selectively.
; [[Importing Content#DotClear|DotClear]] : Import categories, users, posts, comments, and links from a DotClear blog.
; [[Importing Content#Greymatter|GreyMatter]] : Import users, posts, and comments from a Greymatter blog.
; Jerome’s Keywords : Import Jerome’s Keywords into WordPress tags.
; [[Importing Content#LiveJournal|LiveJournal]] : Import posts from a LiveJournal XML export file.
; [[Importing Content#Movable Type|Movable Type]] and [[Importing Content#TypePad|TypePad]] : Import posts and comments from a Movable Type or Typepad blog.
; [[Importing Content|RSS]] :	Import posts from an RSS feed.
; Simple Tagging : Import Simple Tagging tags into WordPress tags.
; [[Importing Content#Textpattern|Textpattern]] : Import categories, users, posts, comments, and links from a Textpattern blog.
; Ultimate Tag Warrior : Import Ultimate Tag Warrior tags into WordPress tags.
; WordPress : Import posts, comments, custom fields, pages, and categories from a WordPress export file.
